data.title: Schindler's List (1993)
data.summary: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazi Germans.

data.title: Braveheart (1995)
data.summary: When his secret bride is executed for assaulting an English soldier who tried to rape her, Sir William Wallace begins a revolt against King Edward I of England.

data.title: Amadeus (1984)
data.summary: The life, success and troubles of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, as told by Antonio Salieri, the contemporary composer who was insanely jealous of Mozart's talent and claimed to have murdered him.

data.title: Lawrence of Arabia (1962)
data.summary: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

data.title: Gone with the Wind (1939)
data.summary: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

data.title: Der Untergang (2004)
data.summary: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.

data.title: The Great Escape (1963)
data.summary: Allied prisoners of war plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.

data.title: Hacksaw Ridge (2016)
data.summary: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, who served during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people, and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.

data.title: Spotlight (I) (2015)
data.summary: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.

data.title: 12 Years a Slave (2013)
data.summary: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup, a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.

data.title: Gold (I) (2018)
data.summary: Set in 1948, the historic story of India's first Olympic medal post their independence.

data.title: Barry Lyndon (1975)
data.summary: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.

data.title: Dunkirk (2017)
data.summary: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German Army, and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II.

data.title: The King's Speech (2010)
data.summary: The story of King George VI of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, his impromptu ascension to the throne and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch become worthy of it.

data.title: All the President's Men (1976)
data.summary: "The Washington Post" reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the details of the Watergate scandal that leads to President Richard Nixon's resignation.

data.title: Straight Outta Compton (2015)
data.summary: The group NWA emerges from the mean streets of Compton in Los Angeles, California, in the mid-1980s and revolutionizes Hip Hop culture with their music and tales about life in the hood.

data.title: Spartacus (1960)
data.summary: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.

data.title: Tombstone (1993)
data.summary: A successful lawman's plans to retire anonymously in Tombstone, Arizona, are disrupted by the kind of outlaws he was famous for eliminating.

data.title: The Big Short (2015)
data.summary: In 2006-7 a group of investors bet against the US mortgage market. In their research they discover how flawed and corrupt the market is.

data.title: Hidden Figures (2016)
data.summary: The story of a team of female African-American mathematicians who served a vital role in NASA during the early years of the U.S. space program.

data.title: Changeling (2008)
data.summary: A grief-stricken mother takes on the LAPD to her own detriment when it tries to pass off an obvious impostor as her missing child.

data.title: Empire of the Sun (1987)
data.summary: A young English boy struggles to survive under Japanese occupation during World War II.

data.title: Mississippi Burning (1988)
data.summary: Two F.B.I. Agents, with wildly different styles, arrive in Mississippi to investigate the disappearance of some civil rights activists.

data.title: Zodiac (2007)
data.summary: In the late 1960s/early 1970s, a San Francisco cartoonist becomes an amateur detective obsessed with tracking down the Zodiac Killer, an unidentified individual who terrorizes Northern California with a killing spree.

data.title: Black Hawk Down (2001)
data.summary: 160 elite U.S. soldiers drop into Somalia to capture two top lieutenants of a renegade warlord and find themselves in a desperate battle with a large force of heavily-armed Somalis.

data.title: The Last Samurai (2003)
data.summary: An American military advisor embraces the Samurai culture he was hired to destroy after he is captured in battle.

data.title: Malcolm X (1992)
data.summary: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam.

data.title: The Favourite (2018)
data.summary: In early 18th century England, a frail Queen Anne (Colman) occupies the throne and her close friend Lady Sarah (Weisz) governs the country in her stead. When a new servant Abigail (Stone) arrives, her charm endears her to Sarah.

data.title: Les Misérables (2012)
data.summary: In 19th-century France, Jean Valjean, who for decades has been hunted by the ruthless policeman Javert after breaking parole, agrees to care for a factory worker's daughter. The decision changes their lives forever.

data.title: Apollo 13 (I) (1995)
data.summary: NASA must devise a strategy to return Apollo 13 to Earth safely after the spacecraft undergoes massive internal damage putting the lives of the three astronauts on board in jeopardy.

data.title: Lo imposible (2012)
data.summary: The story of a tourist family in Thailand caught in the destruction and chaotic aftermath of the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami.

data.title: The Hurt Locker (2008)
data.summary: During the Iraq War, a Sergeant recently assigned to an army bomb squad is put at odds with his squad mates due to his maverick way of handling his work.

data.title: Bridge of Spies (2015)
data.summary: During the Cold War, an American lawyer is recruited to defend an arrested Soviet spy in court, and then help the CIA facilitate an exchange of the spy for the Soviet captured American U2 spy plane pilot, Francis Gary Powers.

data.title: Munich (2005)
data.summary: Based on the true story of the Black September aftermath, about the five men chosen to eliminate the ones responsible for that fateful day.

data.title: Enemy at the Gates (2001)
data.summary: A Russian and a German sniper play a game of cat-and-mouse during the Battle of Stalingrad.

data.title: The Aviator (2004)
data.summary: A biopic depicting the early years of legendary Director and aviator Howard Hughes' career from the late 1920s to the mid 1940s.

data.title: Der Hauptmann (2017)
data.summary: In the last moments of World War II, a young German soldier fighting for survival finds a Nazi captain's uniform. Impersonating an officer, the man quickly takes on the monstrous identity of the perpetrators he is trying to escape from.

data.title: The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society (2018)
data.summary: In the aftermath of World War II, a writer forms an unexpected bond with the residents of Guernsey Island when she decides to write a book about their experiences during the war.

data.title: Darkest Hour (2017)
data.summary: In May 1940, the fate of Western Europe hangs on British Prime Minister Winston Churchill, who must decide whether to negotiate with Adolf Hitler, or fight on knowing that it could mean a humiliating defeat for Britain and its empire.

data.title: Patriots Day (2016)
data.summary: The story of the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing and the aftermath, which includes the city-wide manhunt to find the terrorists responsible.

data.title: Lincoln (2012)
data.summary: As the American Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves.

data.title: Detroit (2017)
data.summary: Fact-based drama set during the 1967 Detroit riots in which a group of rogue police officers respond to a complaint with retribution rather than justice on their minds.

data.title: Kursk (2018)
data.summary: The film follows the 2000 K-141 Kursk submarine disaster and the governmental negligence that followed. As the sailors fight for survival, their families desperately battle political obstacles and impossible odds to save them.

data.title: A Bridge Too Far (1977)
data.summary: Operation Market Garden, September 1944: The Allies attempt to capture several strategically important bridges in the Netherlands in the hope of breaking the German lines. However, mismanagement and poor planning result in its failure.

data.title: Den 12. mann (2017)
data.summary: They were 12 saboteurs. The Nazis killed 11 of them. This is the true story of the one who got away...

data.title: 13 Hours (2016)
data.summary: During an attack on a U.S. compound in Libya, a security team struggles to make sense out of the chaos.

data.title: American Sniper (2014)
data.summary: Navy S.E.A.L. sniper Chris Kyle's pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. Back home to his wife and kids after four tours of duty, however, Chris finds that it is the war he can't leave behind.

data.title: Outlaw King (2018)
data.summary: A true David v Goliath story of how the great 14th Century Scottish 'Outlaw King' Robert The Bruce used cunning and bravery to defeat and repel the much larger and better equipped occupying English army.

data.title: Troy (2004)
data.summary: An adaptation of Homer's great epic, the film follows the assault on Troy by the united Greek forces and chronicles the fates of the men involved.

data.title: The Post (2017)
data.summary: A cover-up that spanned four U.S. Presidents pushed the country's first female newspaper publisher and a hard-driving editor to join an unprecedented battle between the press and the government.

data.title: The Death of Stalin (2017)
data.summary: Follows the Soviet dictator's last days and depicts the chaos of the regime after his death.

data.title: Silence (I) (2016)
data.summary: In the 17th century, two Portuguese Jesuit priests travel to Japan in an attempt to locate their mentor, who is rumored to have committed apostasy, and to propagate Catholicism.

data.title: Kingdom of Heaven (2005)
data.summary: Balian of Ibelin travels to Jerusalem during the Crusades of the 12th century, and there he finds himself as the defender of the city and its people.

data.title: The Patriot (2000)
data.summary: Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son.

data.title: The Founder (2016)
data.summary: The story of Ray Kroc, a salesman who turned two brothers' innovative fast food eatery, McDonald's, into the biggest restaurant business in the world, with a combination of ambition, persistence, and ruthlessness.

data.title: War Horse (2011)
data.summary: Young Albert enlists to serve in World War I after his beloved horse is sold to the cavalry. Albert's hopeful journey takes him out of England and to the front lines as the war rages on.

data.title: We Were Soldiers (2002)
data.summary: The story of the first major battle of the American phase of the Vietnam War, and the soldiers on both sides that fought it, while their wives wait nervously and anxiously at home for the good news or the bad news.

data.title: Cold Mountain (2003)
data.summary: In the waning days of the American Civil War, a wounded soldier embarks on a perilous journey back home to Cold Mountain, North Carolina to reunite with his sweetheart.

data.title: The Danish Girl (2015)
data.summary: A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda's marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili's groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer.

data.title: Deepwater Horizon (2016)
data.summary: A dramatization of the disaster in April 2010, when the offshore drilling rig called the Deepwater Horizon exploded, resulting in the worst oil spill in American history.

data.title: Valkyrie (2008)
data.summary: A dramatization of the 20 July assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Hitler during World War II.

data.title: Charlie Wilson's War (2007)
data.summary: A drama based on a Texas congressman Charlie Wilson's covert dealings in Afghanistan, where his efforts to assist rebels in their war with the Soviets have some unforeseen and long-reaching effects.

data.title: Public Enemies (2009)
data.summary: The Feds try to take down notorious American gangsters John Dillinger, Baby Face Nelson and Pretty Boy Floyd during a booming crime wave in the 1930s.

data.title: In the Heart of the Sea (2015)
data.summary: A recounting of a New England whaling ship's sinking by a giant whale in 1820, an experience that later inspired the great novel Moby-Dick.

data.title: The Stanford Prison Experiment (2015)
data.summary: In 1971, twenty-four male students are selected to take on randomly assigned roles of prisoners and guards in a mock prison situated in the basement of the Stanford psychology building.

data.title: Sweet Country (2017)
data.summary: Australian western set on the Northern Territory frontier in the 1920s, where justice itself is put on trial when an aged Aboriginal farmhand shoots a white man in self-defense and goes on the run as a posse gathers to hunt him down.

data.title: The Black Swan (1942)
data.summary: An ex-pirate contends with rowdy buccaneers and a love-hate relationship with an aristocratic woman who's tougher than she seems.

data.title: Victoria & Abdul (2017)
data.summary: Queen Victoria strikes up an unlikely friendship with a young Indian clerk named Abdul Karim.
"21" is the fact-based story about six MIT students who were trained to become experts in card counting and subsequently took Vegas casinos for millions in winnings.

data.title: Operation Finale (2018)
data.summary: A team of secret agents set out to track down the Nazi officer who masterminded the Holocaust.

data.title: Robin Hood (2010)
data.summary: In 12th century England, Robin and his band of marauders confront corruption in a local village and lead an uprising against the crown that will forever alter the balance of world power.

data.title: Paltan (2018)
data.summary: Film based on 1962 India-China war known as Indo-Sino war.

data.title: Paul, Apostle of Christ (2018)
data.summary: The story covers Paul going from the most infamous persecutor of Christians to Jesus Christ's most influential apostle.

data.title: 12 Strong (2018)
data.summary: 12 Strong tells the story of the first Special Forces team deployed to Afghanistan after 9/11; under the leadership of a new captain, the team must work with an Afghan warlord to take down the Taliban.

data.title: The Happy Prince (2018)
data.summary: The untold story of the last days in the tragic times of Oscar Wilde, a person who observes his own failure with ironic distance and regards the difficulties that beset his life with detachment and humor.

data.title: The Lost City of Z (2016)
data.summary: A true-life drama, centering on British explorer Col. Percival Fawcett, who disappeared whilst searching for a mysterious city in the Amazon in the 1920s.

data.title: The 13th Warrior (1999)
data.summary: A man, having fallen in love with the wrong woman, is sent by the sultan himself on a diplomatic mission to a distant land as an ambassador. Stopping at a Viking village port to restock on supplies, he finds himself unwittingly embroiled on a quest to banish a mysterious threat in a distant Viking land.

data.title: Chappaquiddick (2017)
data.summary: Depicting Ted Kennedy's involvement in the fatal 1969 car accident that claims the life of a young campaign strategist, Mary Jo Kopechne.

data.title: Child 44 (2015)
data.summary: A disgraced member of the Russian military police investigates a series of child murders during the Stalin-era Soviet Union.

data.title: Marie Antoinette (2006)
data.summary: The retelling of France's iconic but ill-fated queen, Marie Antoinette. From her betrothal and marriage to Louis XVI at 15 to her reign as queen at 19 and to the end of her reign as queen, and ultimately the fall of Versailles.

data.title: Woman Walks Ahead (2017)
data.summary: Catherine Weldon, a portrait painter from 1890s Brooklyn, travels to Dakota to paint a portrait of Sitting Bull and becomes embroiled in the Lakota peoples' struggle over the rights to their land.

data.title: King Arthur (2004)
data.summary: A demystified take on the tale of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table.

data.title: Tulip Fever (2017)
data.summary: An artist falls for a young married woman while he's commissioned to paint her portrait during the Tulip mania of 17th century Amsterdam.

data.title: 6 Days (I) (2017)
data.summary: In April 1980, armed gunmen stormed the Iranian Embassy in Princes Gate, London and took all inside hostage. Over the next six days a tense standoff took place, all the while a group of ...                See full summary »

data.title: Pearl Harbor (2001)
data.summary: A tale of war and romance mixed in with history. The story follows two lifelong friends and a beautiful nurse who are caught up in the horror of an infamous Sunday morning in 1941.

data.title: Backstabbing for Beginners (2018)
data.summary: A young program coordinator at the United Nations stumbles upon a conspiracy involving Iraq's oil reserves.

data.title: The Promise (II) (2016)
data.summary: Set during the last days of the Ottoman Empire, The Promise follows a love triangle between Michael, a brilliant medical student, the beautiful and sophisticated Ana, and Chris - a renowned American journalist based in Paris.

data.title: Colette (2018)
data.summary: Colette is pushed by her husband to write novels under his name. Upon their success, she fights to make her talents known, challenging gender norms.

data.title: Entebbe (2018)
data.summary: Inspired by the true events of the 1976 hijacking of an Air France flight en route from Tel Aviv to Paris, and the most daring rescue mission ever attempted.

data.title: Peterloo (2018)
data.summary: The story of the 1819 Peterloo Massacre where British forces attacked a peaceful pro-democracy rally in Manchester.

data.title: Alexander (2004)
data.summary: Alexander, the King of Macedonia and one of the greatest army leaders in the history of warfare, conquers much of the known world.

data.title: Shock and Awe (2017)
data.summary: A group of journalists covering former President George W. Bush's planned invasion of Iraq in 2003 are skeptical of the President's claim that Saddam Hussein has "weapons of mass destruction."

data.title: Pompeii (I) (2014)
data.summary: A slave-turned-gladiator finds himself in a race against time to save his true love, who has been betrothed to a corrupt Roman Senator. As Mount Vesuvius erupts, he must fight to save his beloved as Pompeii crumbles around him.

data.title: Caligola (1979)
data.summary: Details the graphic and shocking, yet undeniably tragic story of Rome's most infamous Caesar, Gaius Germanicus Caligula.

data.title: First Man (2018)
data.summary: A look at the life of the astronaut, Neil Armstrong, and the legendary space mission that led him to become the first man to walk on the Moon on July 20, 1969.

data.title: 10,000 BC (2008)
data.summary: A prehistoric epic that follows a young mammoth hunter's journey through uncharted territory to secure the future of his tribe.

data.title: Death of a Nation (2018)
data.summary: This documentary draws parallels between the dramatic fracturing of the nation over Abraham Lincoln's presidency and the presidency of Donald Trump.
Bank heist movie in the vein of "End of Watch" meets "Black Hawk Down".

data.title: The Irishman (2019)
data.summary: A mob hitman recalls his possible involvement with the slaying of Jimmy Hoffa.

data.title: Mary Queen of Scots (2018)
data.summary: Mary Stuart's attempt to overthrow her cousin Elizabeth I, Queen of England, finds her condemned to years of imprisonment before facing execution.
